blog.name: thegeekembassy
blog.title: The Geek Embassy
blog.description:
The ambassadors of Geek Embassy endeavor to share all types of geeky passions with our community. As a group, we write individually but we come together to share our collective experiences with different media. For TGE Watches, we talk about movies and TV shows. TGE Plays, we play games together. For TGE Reads, we select a book, read it, and then discuss it together. We are hoping through our collective knowledge and know-how to share these geeky interests with our readers, viewers, and listeners. 

Listen to our podcast at https://www.thegeekembassy.com/category/podcast

tags: Game of Thrones Reunions We Can&039;t Wait For
summary: Game of Thrones Reunions We Can't Wait For: Arya and Melisandre
title: Game of Thrones Reunions We Can't Wait For: Arya and Melisandre
body:
Game of Thrones Reunions We Can’t Wait For: Arya and Melisandre

Many of the exciting reunions we can expect in the final season of Game of Thrones are from characters who have a lot of history between them. But there are two characters who interacted for less than a minute, and their reunion has the potential to be one of the most interesting. Those two characters are Arya and Melisandre.

The Meeting

Arya and Melisandre meet when the latter comes to take…

View On WordPress

question: arya for the ask game!
answer:
Arya (ASOIAF + Game of Thrones)

send me a character and i’ll list:

  • favorite thing about them - ferocity, strong spirit, resistance to patriarchal standards, loyalty, the kindness she shows to the small folk 
  • least favorite thing about them - again, even her ‘negative’ traits define her! i don’t have any ‘least favorite’ thing about her, except for how D&D did her character dirty last season 
  • favorite line - “she tried so hard to be brave, to be fierce as a wolverine and all, but sometimes she felt like she was just a little girl after all”
  • brOTP - travelling with yoren, gendry, hot pie, and lommy 
  • OTP - gendry!!!
  • nOTP - jon snow
  • random headcanon - even though she is a brave bean i feel like she would have crawled in to bed with ned and cat during a storm
  • unpopular opinion - i hope arya’s braavos storyline ends soon, i think its great but its so isolated and i want her back in westeros reconnecting with her family and nymeria
  • song i associate with them - beggin for thread by banks

summary: Why would they name their daughters as Sansa and Arya ? Why not as Minisa and Lyarra ?
question: Why would they name their daughters as Sansa and Arya ? Why not as Minisa and Lyarra ?
answer:
I can see a couple of reasons, any of which might have contributed. There are Watsonian reasons.

Minisa and Lyarra both died when Ned and Cat were fairly young, impacting on their ability to develop a close and lasting relationship with their mothers into adulthood, the sort of relationship that would drive them to name their daughters after their own mothers.

There could well be a cultural bias, too, which regards those immediate female relatives as less worthy of commemoration through the next generation’s naming scheme. So if Ned and Catelyn wanted Stark names for their girls, and liked the names of the late Sansa Stark and Ned’s maternal grandmother Arya Flint, it’s possible they saw no compelling reason to honour their mothers rather than select for personal preference.

And then there’s the Doylist reason: GRRM hadn’t thought of Ned’s mother’s name (and didn’t until recently). Unfortunately, I think it’s likely that he hadn’t named Minisa Tully until ACoK, either.

So if Ned and Catelyn wanted Stark names for their girls, and liked the names of the late Sansa Stark and Ned’s maternal grandmother Arya Flint, it’s possible they saw no compelling reason to honour their mothers rather than select for personal preference.

And then there’s the Doylist reason: GRRM hadn’t thought of Ned’s mother’s name (and didn’t until recently). Unfortunately, I think it’s likely that he hadn’t named Minisa Tully until ACoK, either.
trail.content:
I can see a couple of reasons, any of which might have contributed. There are Watsonian reasons.

Minisa and Lyarra both died when Ned and Cat were fairly young, impacting on their ability to develop a close and lasting relationship with their mothers into adulthood, the sort of relationship that would drive them to name their daughters after their own mothers.

There could well be a cultural bias, too, which regards those immediate female relatives as less worthy of commemoration through the next generation’s naming scheme. So if Ned and Catelyn wanted Stark names for their girls, and liked the names of the late Sansa Stark and Ned’s maternal grandmother Arya Flint, it’s possible they saw no compelling reason to honour their mothers rather than select for personal preference.

And then there’s the Doylist reason: GRRM hadn’t thought of Ned’s mother’s name (and didn’t until recently). Unfortunately, I think it’s likely that he hadn’t named Minisa Tully until ACoK, either.

description:
Chapters: 2/2
Fandom: Game of Thrones (TV), Game of Thrones RPF, A Song of Ice and Fire - George R. R. Martin, A Song of Ice and Fire & Related Fandoms
Rating: Not Rated
Warnings: No Archive Warnings Apply
Relationships: Arya Stark/Gendry Waters, Arya Stark & Gendry Waters, Jon Snow & Arya Stark, Arya Stark & Sansa Stark, Sandor Clegane & Arya Stark, Jon Snow & Arya Stark & Sansa Stark

Summary:

Arya Stark has spent years running from who she was. But now, she is back in Winterfell, and Jon is coming home. Arya reunites with people from her past, and finally gets a moment of joy.
Formerly A Pack’s Reunion.


chapter 2! Jon’s POV!

Main Blog• Organic-Freedom.

tags: a song of ice and fire
body:
Game Of Thrones: Season 8

Please, please, for the love of the gods, don’t let their be a rivalry or hatred between Sansa/Arya and Daenerys. Sansa and Daenerys have gone through a lot of the same traumatic experiences and both come out on top, while Daenerys and Arya both are females fighting their way through a male-dominated position. These girls would fucking love and respect each other and I will fight anyone who doesn’t agree.
